DOC.brief_summary: This trial conduct order compare angiographic outcomes patient receive 0.014-0.0155 '' platinum frame fill coil ( large diameter coil ) versus treat solely coil less 0.014 '' ( standard diameter ) . Hypothesis : Angiographic occlusion follow-up imaging frequent patient receive 0.014-0.0155 '' platinum coil embolization compare receive smaller-diameter coil .
DOC.brief_title: Framing Eighteen Coils Cerebral Aneurysms Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Primary Study Objective : Occlusion rate : angiographic occlusion , improvement change post-coiling appearance aneurysm judge independent core lab follow-up angiography 12-18 month endovascular embolization . Secondary Objectives : 1 . Treatment related morbidity mortality , measure NIH stroke scale . 2 . Packing density measure volumetric fill aneurysm . 3 . Clinical outcome 3-6 12-18 month post-coiling , measure modify Rankin scale . 4 . Re-hemorrhage re-treatment rate . Study Design : FEAT prospective , randomized trial compare utilization 0.014-0.0155 '' coil versus small diameter coil mid-sized aneurysm treatment . The 0.014-0.0155 '' bare platinum coil ( Stryker , Natick , MA ) FDA-approved common use institution country across world . Patients enrol meet inclusion criterion consent participate . Patients randomly assigned central web-based system 1:1 manner either framing coil treatment non-framing coil treatment . Data patient collect time enrollment treatment , first second follow-up visit .
